org.threadly.concurrent

Class PrioritySchedulerWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.concurrent.PrioritySchedulerWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Executor, PrioritySchedulerInterface, SimpleSchedulerInterface, SubmitterExecutorInterface, SubmitterSchedulerInterface

    public class PrioritySchedulerWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
implements PrioritySchedulerInterface

    Class to wrap any implementation of PrioritySchedulerInterface. The purpose of wrapping like this would be to change the default priority from the wrapped instance. That way this could be passed into other parts of code and although use the same thread pool, have different default priorities. (this could be particularly useful when used in combination with TaskExecutorDistributor, or TaskSchedulerDistributor.

    Since:
    1.0.0

      • submit

        public ListenableFuture<?> submit(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Description copied from interface: SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Submit a task to run as soon as possible. There is a slight increase in load when using submit over execute. So this should only be used when the future is necessary. The future .get() method will return null once the runnable has completed.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface SubmitterExecutorInterface
        Parameters:
        task - runnable to be executed
        Returns:
        a future to know when the task has completed
